channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: These Happy Couples Aren't Sharing Bank Accounts---They're Sharing Spreadsheets
item.description: Spouses search for a better way to divide their household expenses.

item.title: Trump vows to build U.S. bitcoin reserve. Crypto community is cheering.
item.description: Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump on Saturday said he would “immediately” appoint a bitcoin and crypto presidential advisory council upon taking office, if he wins the U.S. presidential election in November.

item.title: Why the Great Stock Rotation Is Skipping Consumer Staples
item.description: Uneven earnings and worries about the U.S. consumer are dragging on the sector.

item.title: ‘I’m not jealous — just genuinely curious’: How can a woman work from home and mind her 3-year-old child at the same time?
item.description: “What do you all think about employees who work from home and have little kids to watch at the same time?”

item.title: Investors Gobble Up Bonds That Can Turn Into Stocks
item.description: Lyft, Snap and others are raising money by issuing convertible bonds.

item.title: ‘We’re still paid less — and do more unpaid child care and domestic chores than men’: What have Kamala Harris and Hillary Clinton done for working women like me?
item.description: “We’re still paid less and do more unpaid child care.”

item.title: Bill Ackman's Pershing Square Plans to Proceed With IPO
item.description: The NYSE says that the listing was “pending on a date to be announced.”

item.title: ‘We let our lawyers duke it out’: My $300K brokerage account was accidentally omitted from my divorce. Should I say something?
item.description: “There was no mention of this brokerage account that was in my name even during our divorce though it was opened during our marriage.”

item.title: The Score: Delta Air Lines, Tesla, Warner Bros. Discovery and More Stocks That Defined the Week
item.description: Here are some of the major companies whose stocks moved on the week’s news.

item.title: Musk and other billionaires may not like what ‘Trump 2.0’ does to their wealth
item.description: Investors may be wise to hedge against ‘Trump-flation.’
